stories.original_headline: Intermittent fasting fails to beat standard dieting for weight loss
stories.original_summary: Intermittent fasting has become one of the most talked-about weight loss trends in recent years, promising dramatic results with simple changes to when you eat. But a major Cochrane review suggests the reality may be far less exciting. After analyzing 22 clinical trials involving nearly 2,000 adults
stories.fantasy_headline: New Slimming Ritual No Better Than Old Ways, Alchemists Say
stories.fantasy_story: A popular new 'fasting' ritual for shedding extra pounds has been making rounds in the villages. Many believed it held powerful magic for slimming down quickly. However, the Grand Alchemists' Council, after many experiments, has declared it no more effective than traditional eating habits for those seeking a svelter figure. It seems simple discipline still holds the true enchantment.

stories.original_headline: Ancient microbes may have used oxygen 500 million years before it filled Earth’s atmosphere
stories.original_summary: Life on Earth may have learned to breathe oxygen long before oxygen filled the skies. MIT researchers traced a key oxygen-processing enzyme back hundreds of millions of years before the Great Oxidation Event. Early microbes living near oxygen-producing cyanobacteria may have quickly used up the gas
stories.fantasy_headline: Ancient Spirits Breathed Sky-Breath Before the Great Veil Formed
stories.fantasy_story: Long before the Great Veil of Air filled the skies, tiny elemental spirits may have known how to use the vital Sky-Breath. Elder Wizards, studying ancient scrolls, found evidence of a mystical key that processed this essence. These earliest beings lived near glowing mosses that made Sky-Breath, consuming it long before it was abundant.

stories.original_headline: The RAM crunch could kill products and even entire companies, memory exec admits
stories.original_summary: Phison is one of the leading makers of controller chips for SSDs and other flash memory devices - and CEO Pua Khein-Seng has now become a leading voice for just how bad the RAM shortage might get. Companies may need to cut back their product lines in the second half of 2026, and some companies […]
stories.fantasy_headline: Scarcity of Memory Crystals Threatens Guilds
stories.fantasy_story: The Guild of Memorycrafters warns of a dire scarcity of enchanted memory crystals. These vital artifacts are crucial for creating all new magical devices. The Guild Master fears that many clans will have to cease crafting some of their beloved items, and some smaller workshops might even falter without enough crystals.

stories.original_headline: Dyson turned its skinny PencilVac into a lightweight wet floor cleaner
stories.original_summary: Dyson has announced an alternate version of its skinny PencilVac that's designed to clean spills and stains on hard floors instead of sucking up dirt and debris. Like the PencilVac, which Dyson called "world's slimmest vacuum cleaner" when it was announced nine months ago, the new PencilWash squeeze
stories.fantasy_headline: Dyson Reveals New Slender Staff for Spills and Stains
stories.fantasy_story: Master Tinkerer Dyson has unveiled a new version of his famed Slender Staff of Sweeping. This latest artifact, called the Slender Staff of Cleansing, is enchanted specifically to tackle wet spills and stubborn stains on stone and wooden floors. It promises to be as light and easy to wield as its dirt-sucking predecessor.
